title: Creating a new account via Switch Accounts is blocked
description:
### Summary

Creating new account via switch account page freezes the page after channel is created.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open app.
2. make sure you have multiple accounts connected.
3. Navigate to switch account.
4. tap on create new channel.
5. enter details and join minds.
6. switch account page with new account appears but user is not automatically logged in - no onboarding shows up and the switch account page cannot be dismissed as it is frozen. 

### Platform information 

iPhone 13 Pro - Staging

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

App freezes after sign up via switch account page

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

App should function correctly and display onboarding.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![RPReplay_Final1683032821](/uploads/7d8a97edaf2780ca93011faa4beae420/RPReplay_Final1683032821.mov)

title: Videos disappear from feed after upload
description:
### Summary

After a video is uploaded and the page is refreshed, the video seems to disappear from the channel feed.

### Steps to reproduce

desktop:
- upload video
- refresh page
- additionally, you may try the filter tool to find the video; initially this worked for me but did not work on subsequent attempts

mobile:
- upload video
- refresh
- once again filtering may be tried but this never worked for me on mobile

### Platform information 

windows 11, google chrome; android 12

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

after the user refreshes, the video seems to just disappear as though it were made unlisted. post can still be found if the user has the link.
- desktop, https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GnZMFK4Jwy25D-KAZLY6Dlod4RiY5-zm/view?usp=share_link

- mobile

![XRecorder_01052023_115704](/uploads/ccd8ddaf888598a410aea94037943927/XRecorder_01052023_115704.mp4)

description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.

### Summary

Boost channel in-feed notice does not go away

Extend the scope to make sure all in-feed notices are dismissible.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Have in-feed notice in the feed
2. Try dismissing it by clicking Learn More
3. Try dismissing it by clicking Boost Now
4. See that neither worked

### Platform information 

iOS, 4.34.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The in-feed notice stays, even after boosting the channel.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The notice should go away if:
1. User clicks Learn More
2. User clicks Boost Now

title: Mob: Channel & Group suggestions in onboarding
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

Increase the % of newly registered users who subscribe to channels and join groups in their first session, to improve short term user retention.

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- Interest tag selection is not skippable -- user must select at least 3 interests before proceeding.
- Add Channel and Group suggestions in new user onboarding flow, after user interest tag selection.
- Channel & Group suggestions are influenced by tag selections.
- Channel & Group suggestions ARE skippable.

Deploy as an experiment.

- Control: Tag selection is not skippable, but Channel & Group suggestions are not presented during onboarding.
- Variant: Tag selection is not skippable, and Channel & Group suggestions are presented afterward.

Measure for:

- Channel subscriptions
- Group joins
- User returned after 48 hours

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/KIrgbpzbogAlPq8Ln1qDHF/NUX-Research-and-UX?node-id=168-20021)

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

Metrics to watch 
- Number of subscribers per user 
- We hypothesized that since number of subscribers positively correlates to retention for the data we've seen, that if a user subscribes to a greater number of channels / is served more relevant content, they are more likely to retain and stay on the platform.
- 2-3 day retention (user signs up, uses Minds, closes app, rejoins, logs back in and uses within window)

- variant vs. control (existing design)

title: Mob: Hide suspected spam comments
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Reduce impact of spam by hiding comments that are suspected of spam.

## What needs to be done

We can automatically identify that comments are spam with a high degree of accuracy, but still want human review before they're removed from the site. When a comment is automatically identified as spam -- but before human review -- we should hide the comments from view, and enable the community to show the comments and give feedback about whether or not the automatic spam detection was accurate.

[We got some feedback from the community about a feature like this here](https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1437588985613389832).

title: Referrals link is invisible on dark / light mode (Mobile)
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

(Summarize the bug encountered concisely)

If a user uses dark mode on mobile, and tries to access the referrals link, they can go to the current referrals page. However, the referral link text is currently invisible. (referral link text is same as background color.)

The problem manifest only when switching from one mode to another. The color of default text do not update correctly.


### Steps to reproduce

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

Step 1: On mobile app, switch to dark mode. 
Step 2: Go on sidebar navigation menu, and access settings page. 
Step 3: Go from the settings page to other -> click on referrals page.
Step 4: On referrals page, view referral links, and you will notice that the css-color of the link is not being changed between light and dark mode.

Note- sometimes this flips, so that light mode is legible, but dark mode is not. See below. 

![image](/uploads/0b59e39aaf6efa209d68f56f2736cc5e/image.png)

### Platform information 

(Browser, device, system stats, screen size)
- Mobile apps (React Native, iOS, Android)

![image](/uploads/2be937712b6679f69d2666ed92cabcb9/image.png)

![image](/uploads/a632ed26beed6cff6e3e12f0297d080d/image.png)

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- expected behavior should be white text in dark mode, primary text in light mode.

description:

In order to expand the affiliates program, we wish to be able to use the referral links for logged in users too. The tags can then be used to attribute the referrer.

title: Moments: Timer
description:
## Goal

Improve Moments UX

---

As a Minds, I want to increase Boost inventory supply so that I can better fulfill the demands of customers.

## What needs to be done

Add a 20s timer to moments with an animation in the page indicator

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

TBD

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/W2xIag64EdbWUlGAQOpVHE/Boost-Update?node-id=755%3A18187&t=0SXJFqBrQKqxdiqo-1)

We will also be putting a 20-second timer on the duration of each moment from now on, both non-boosted and boosted moments. This timer will apply to a progress line above each moment. The normal transition between different users' moments will continue to be used. 

**Start of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs](/uploads/633c82d87ad68fca76ae0a02bfb5c197/Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs.png)

**End of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs](/uploads/608fd706171f00bea46b0616a828ab0e/Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs.png)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->

Moments users

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] apply a 20s timer to each moment page
* [ ] long pressing the screen or interacting with the post (comments, share, etc.) should pause the timer
* [ ] the page indicator on top of the moments should fill to show the progress of the timer
* [ ] no progress if the moment timer if it's a video or better mimic the progress with the video progress.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

## Goal

Introduce a horizontal bar like we have used in the past for full-site alerts for the purpose of educating users about the referral and commission program.

## What needs to be done

title: IAP: Add FF to potentially hide cash option for GooglePlay users
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues

--->

Old title: ~~IAP: Implement Android item payment for boost + dummy API call (optional iOS)~~

## Goal

Provide in-app purchase support to app.

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->


## What needs to be done

~~- Implement Android item payment for Minds Plus~~
~~- Add relevant screens and hooks~~
~~- Add dummy API call for backend~~
~~- (optional) add iOS support~~

Impossible to have a decent technical solution. The current UI would generate 464 unique products with values from $1 to $9000 to be defined in Google Play In-App Purchases.

Repurposed to 
- keep the boost cash option behind a feature flag (default off) - `mob-4836-iap-no-cash`
- prepare an appeal to be sent to Google following their terms violation warning, arguing that there's no decent technical solution to implement boosts with IAP in absence of quantity thus requiring the implementation of at least 454 distinct products, and also the lack of prepaid product since we cannot bill the users after the service would be provided.

@markryansallee, @ottman, @markharding

title: Mob: Add context to previews of paywalled premium content
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Increase engagement with PREMIUM content from Minds+ subscribers by making the posts more appealing / engaging to users without Minds+ subscriptions.

## What needs to be done

- Update the presentation of Minds+ paywalled content

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

At a high level, changes fall into three categories:

1. Expose text content for media-based posts
2. Add social proof context to paywalled posts (e.g. Bill follows Jack)
3. Reduce blur of images for image-based posts

#### 1.

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/lkwynaYCljUsoeFTqTNJJr/Minds%2B-Paywall?node-id=0%3A1&t=cgizQiiqxEyXdgPW-1)

**Continue Reading Added: Similar use to 'See More' however in this case we use the primary color for the link to serve as a distinguishing factor between the two. Also, when 'Continue reading' is clicked it will open up the Minds+ Modal to subscribe to Minds+ just like the 'Unlock Post' button.**

![1_Continue_reading_added_mob](/uploads/ebd92ad9c12d7fea587550729587bdeb/1_Continue_reading_added_mob.png)

#### 2.

**Addition of 'X' follows 'Y' reusing the remind location. In the case where a Minds+ post is reminded and has this already on the post, the remind would supersede and take priority as the main notice on the post. This is similar to the location we used when we implemented this for Superminds. Icon used in the design is the same as the current 'Groups' material icon**

![2_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added_mob](/uploads/99e2044e08337641a6b67a40cde762c8/2_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added_mob.png)

**'X' and 'Z' follow 'Y'**

![3_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__2_People__mob](/uploads/5bf839e7137d99a9f9f8491d49a04aa4/3_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__2_People__mob.png)

**'X' and 'N others' follow 'Y' where N >= 2**

![4_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__1+N__n___2__mob](/uploads/4248645ad1dc9481cfd30f62d5e6052a/4_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__1+N__n___2__mob.png)


| Top Bar Text | Do I follow Mark? | Do I follow Emerson? | Do I follow Jack     |  Do I follow 'X others' | 
| ------------ | ----------------- | -------------------- | -------------------- | ----------------------- |
| Mark follows Emerson | Yes | No | N/A | N/A|
| Mark and Jack follow Emerson| Yes | No | Yes | N/A |
| Mark and 2 others follow Emerson | Yes| No | N/A | Yes |

#### 3.

Reduce blur amount/strength considerably to help give the user more context to unlock the post and join Minds+ to see the full unblurred image.

Equivalent to ~20px blur in CSS.

![5_Reduced_blur_mob](/uploads/cb53dfbd19932f875a527c80f414eb80/5_Reduced_blur_mob.png)

## Mobile

<!---
Does a mobile card need to be created? Any notes for mobile?
--->

- [ ] Is Mobile Required?

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

- Deploy as an experiment and measure for engagement
- Secondary metric: Users clicking "Unlock" button

title: Mobile component (Boost Rotator)
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

To design a native like mobile component for our in-feed boost rotator. 

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- To design a mobile version of the in-feed boost rotator, with a carousel / swipe interaction. 
- Note - The carousel wraps around, so the last post will, upon a users' swipe surface the first boosted post in the rotator feed again.
- To ensure some parity between web and mobile, **tapping onto a boosted post will take the user to the specific SEP**, instead of a full screen/moments like carousel.  
- suggestion: use reanimated/snap carousel 
- use suggested height or adjust based on device screen height.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

-swipe interaction on mobile, similar to Instagram

link - https://www.figma.com/file/zheu8ANcXw49YL6kSfSmlh/Boost---In-feed-rotator-(Settings)?node-id=274%3A19642

title: Add boosts to story swiper
description:
## Goal

Increase Boost impressions.

---

As a Minds, I want to increase Boost inventory supply so that I can better fulfill the demands of customers.

## What needs to be done

Add a Boost slot to the mobile story swiper.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/W2xIag64EdbWUlGAQOpVHE/Boost-Update?node-id=755%3A18187&t=0SXJFqBrQKqxdiqo-1)

We will be increasing boost inventory space by placing boosted posts in between moments similar to how Instagram does sponsored posts in between stories. 

We will also be putting a 20-second timer on the duration of each moment from now on, both non-boosted and boosted moments. This timer will apply to a progress line above each moment. The normal transition between different user's moments will continue to be used. 

**Start of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs](/uploads/5deda1ec8e909e4763557a60ecfa4cdf/Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs.png)

**End of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs](/uploads/e34aa2d78f451f8ca7735beee55ff582/Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs.png)

## Personas

<!---

--->

--->

title: Camera Not Functioning Correctly Within Post Creation
description:
### Summary On using the "camera" icon within the post creation / "speak your mind" screen, I am presented with a "an error occurred Tab to copy the error" message. ### Platform information Discovered using Minds Mobile Application - Android "unfettered" variant (version 4.32.0 / 4.32.1 (1050000159 / 1050000160)) via Android version 13 (LineageOS version 20-20230221). User: Danzillawhite:minds.com has also reported the same issue within the General:minds.com chat room while using Android version 12 (Samsung One UI version 4.1). ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots The following is the error stack report: ``` undefined is not a function STACK: in wrappedComponent in RCTView in Unknown in PermissionsCheck in RCTView in Unknown in wrappedComponent in StaticContainer in EnsureSingleNavigator in SceneView in RCTView in Unknown in RCTView in Unknown in RCTView in Unknown in CardSheet in RCTView in Unknown in AnimatedComponent in AnimatedComponentWrapper in PanGestureHandler in PanGestureHandler in RCTView in Unknown in AnimatedComponent in AnimatedComponentWrapper in RCTView in Unknown in Card in CardContainer in RNSScreen in AnimatedComponent in AnimatedComponentWrapper in Suspender in Suspense in Freeze in DelayedFreeze in MaybeFreeze in Screen in MaybeScreen in RNSScreenContainer in ScreenContainer in MaybeScreenContainer in RCTView in Unknown in Background in CardStack in RCTView in Unknown in SafeAreaProviderCompat in RNGestureHandlerRootView in GestureHandlerRootView in StackView in Unknown in StackNavigator in wrappedComponent in WCContextProvider in ErrorBoundary in PortalProviderComponent in BottomSheetModalProviderWrapper in _Theme in _ThemeProvider in _TamaguiProvider in UIProvider in PortalProviderComponent in FriendlyCaptchaProvider in ToastProvider in ThemeProvider in AppMessageProvider in MobXProvider in QueryClientProvider in QueryProvider in StoresProvider in EnsureSingleNavigator in BaseNavigationContainer in ThemeProvider in NavigationContainerInner in RNCSafeAreaProvider in SafeAreaProvider in GrowthBookProvider in ExperimentsProvider in RCTView in Unknown in App in RCTView in Unknown in RCTView in Unknown in AppContainer ``` Reference: * Danzillawhite:minds.com's General Chat Room Based Report (20230223T23:37Z)

title: Add CPM to Boost console for completed Boosts
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Help customers understand the ROI of their Boosts by displaying the CPM (cost per thousand views) of a completed Boost.

## What needs to be done

Add the calculated CPM to the Boost console view of _completed_ Boosts.

A CPM result could look something like...

- $3.00
- 5 tokens

Include a tooltip (on hover) with the following copy:

> CPM is the cost per 1,000 views (cost per mille)
